meanings.definition: The property of a material to conduct electricity when exposed to light.
meanings.sent1: The photoconductivities of the solar panel allow it to generate electricity from sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the photoconductivities of different materials to improve solar cell efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The photoconductivities of the light bulb were so high that it started glowing as soon as the sun rose.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of photoconductivities was like a light switch, illuminating her path to understanding.
meanings.sent5: The photoconductivities of the firefly's tail make it a natural lantern in the dark night.

meanings.definition: The measurement of the ability of a material to conduct electricity when illuminated.
meanings.sent1: The lab technician recorded the photoconductivities of the new material for analysis.
meanings.sent2: A high-tech device was used to measure the photoconductivities of the semiconductor.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the most accurate photoconductivities measurement was intense among the researchers.
meanings.sent4: The photoconductivities measurement acted as a spotlight, revealing the material's electrical properties.
meanings.sent5: The photoconductivities measurement was like a magnifying glass, zooming in on the material's conductivity.
